Ok I havent been playing for a while due to life.

So because of that, I wasnt able to complete the last unfinished Ranger, Cleric, Assassin build, I posted.

So I came up with this idea, which I think can be the most OPTIMIZED of the X/SD/Assassin builds.

Monk/SD/Assassin lacks the spellcasting buffs.

Bard/SD/Assassin has the spellcasting, bard song buffs, but lacks the ranger/Cleric/monk,/SD/Assassin BAB, AB progression. Ranger has the AB, even spells, but not the right spells, and the spells come later.

Cleric/SD/Ass, gives good AB, BAB, early spellcasting, GOOD BUFFS.

That combination is probably the best, OPTIMIZED, but it does have the CON of lack of skill points, and cross classing, and not being able to take SD, Assassin until later, instead of earlier at lev 6.

Fortunately that is mitigated by playing a human, having a 14 int, for extra skill points. Also taking SD, Assassin at levels 9, 10, instead of earlier at lev 6, is not that bad. And taking 8 levs of cleric to start can be good.

I took the magic domain, and War domains for the wizardly buffing spells: Mage Armor, Cats Grace, Stoneskin for BEST OVERALL SPELL BUFFING PACKAGE IN THE GAME.

This combination is great at both, going alone, and in a party as a support, healer, trap disabler, lock opener, scout, flanker, artillery(Ice Storm, Melfs Acid Arrow, decent damage spells), Party Buffer, semi back up tank(has decent AB, AC), death attacker, turn undead, etc, great at finding a way to deal with most stuff, good summoning package.

Cleric 11, /,Shadowdancer 4,/, Assassin 5

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings Asturonethoriusaline!

Unfortunately I dont know Arkhalia that well but I hope some of the feedback is helpful

Planning: 
- I recommend having a look at the CBC Excel Spreadsheet (https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... ulator-cbc), I use this to plan my builds, and quite a few here do. I know quite a few of the builders here do it by hand, those builders do have quite an indepth knowledge of the NWN rules. 
- There is a specific format many of the builders use, it might be good to have a look at that to make it easier to communicate to us if you don't have Microsoft Excel or another program that can use the spreadsheet

Class distribution:
- Dex Cleric / Shadowdancer / Assassin sounds quite nice. 
- I suspect Cleric / Shadowdancer / Rogue would be more powerful, as this grants you many more skill points as well as evasion and epic dodge. It all depends if Assassin has been changed much from Vanilla NWN. If it is pretty similar then Rogue will probably be more useful.
- I would suggest trying to get to Cleric 15+, spells like Divine Favor, Greater Magic Weapon hit their peak at that level.
- SD 5 sounds good
- That leaves Rogue/Assassin and how many levels you invest in that depends. In general you will want to stop when you get a bonus feat and/or an odd level, for example Rogue 13 or Rogue 19.

Pre-Epic:
- I would suggest a Cleric 12 / SD 4 / Assassin 4 pre-epic split to maximise the amount of BAB.

That might be enough to get you started for now, if theres anything else specific to work on further let us know.

Thanks Orion for the help, suggestions.

As to why I will go Assassin over rogue:

Assassin gets 6 skill points + int mod. Thats ONLY 2 less then rogue.

And you get Ghostly Visage, Uncanny Dodge, Death Attack.

The death attack paralyzes opponents, except for undead.

The plan is to use Hide in Plain Site(HIPS), and Ghostly Visage, Shadow Evade to sneak up to foes, hit them with say a 5 to 20 D6 Death Attack that 1. Does about 50 to 100 to 150 damage, then with a high Death Attack DC, they get paralyzed, where you can either disengage, HIPS, then Death attack them again, paralyze them again, do another 50 to 100 to 150 to 200 damage. Rinae, Repeat over and over. Or you can just finish them off after the first, second death attack paralyzation.

And if the paralyzation doesnt work, you still can HIPS, get at least the sneak attack damage.

And you can use poison, to inlict stat damage to weaken their str, con, dex, AB, AC, etc.

About the only thing Assassin may not get is Evasion. Assassins may or may not get it, I dint know.

But even if dont get Evasion, toon has high Dex save to evade anyways, an or the toon can just kill or paralyze the source that would seem to make Evasion seem like it necessary. And the toon can disable traps, making Evasion less needed.

I think trading Evasion for Death Attack, Ghostly Visage, Poison use, etc, is a FAIR trade off.

As to the splits, if going to go with Assassin, the death attack DC needs to be as high as possible.

A Assassin needs to have at least about 22,23,24 levels at minimum.

A Cleric 11/ SD 5, Assassin 24, accomplishes that. Also there are Assassin Specific either abilities or Epic Feats, etc, that a Assassin only gets at about level 22,23,24.

Mick Dagger a credible poster here is kind of a expert at, on Assassins, and he recommends an Assassin level minimum of about 22,23,24, and as high as go up to level 30 depend on if there is room, IF the Assassin part is the Primary of the toon.

Why Cleric 11? Because Cleric 11 is the ABSOLUTE MINIMUM level for, to get 6th level spells like Blade Barrier, and Absolute mininum for buffs according to experts here is about level 11,12, if Cleric is NOT your primary, and is instead your secondary or third.

Also Cleric Level 11 lets me mazimize Assassin as much as possible at level 24..

If I go Cleric Level 15/SD 5, that would only allow 20 levels of Assassin, which would probably not be enough Assassin levels.

If going to take only 20 levels or less, your right that Rogue would probably be better then Assassin.

Yeah a Cleric 11/ SD 4/Assassin 5 is semi sub optimal for Pre Epic, for Post Epic BAB, AB, but that is only about 1,2,3, about + or - 1 point, difference to BAB, AB, and thats not that bad.

However, if Assassin can get its special things by, on Assassin level 23, instead of level 24, then that would leave enough room for a Cleric 12/SD 5/Assassin 23 post Epic, and a 12/4/4 pre epic split. I might need Mick Dagger's or others help here on that.

Now if go with Rogue, instead of Assassin, then a Cleric 15/SD 5/Rogue 20, would work just fine.

Also I think that Cleric/SD/Assassin build can also take epic dodge, BUT they just have to take the right feats to qualify. At least thats what I remember reading in the WIKI, but I could be wrong there.

Where I need the most help is which epic feats to get and when to take them.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
With Cleric there are better options than Assassin.
Dex based Cleric/SD/Rogue and Cleric/SD/Monk can get Epic dodge. Cleric/SD/Assassin can also get ED, but only if you take 10 levels of SD, and that leaves little room for Assassin.
My recommendations are Cleric 26/ Rogue 13/ SD 1 or Cleric 26/ Monk 9/ SD 5.

If you are bent on Assassin for the Death attack paralysis, beware that it has been nerfed with NWN EE. 
If you still want Assassin, Monk 9/ SD 5/ As 26 and Rogue 13/ SD 1/ As 26 are solid Assassin builds with ED.
If you still want Cleric for the buffs, remember that you have to cross-class the stealth skills and will need 13 levels of Cleric before you can pick Assassin. 
I would suggest the following class split; Cleric 15/ Assassin 24/ SD 1, where SD is there for HIPS and nothing more.
If you stop at Cleric 13, 14 or 15 pre epic, your best BAB at lvl 20 will be 14. You cannot stop at Cleric 12 because you need Cleric 13 before you can go with Assassin and you don't want Cleric 16 if you are serious about improving the Death attack DC.

I am not saying that Cleric/Assassin is a bad idea, after all it is a Cleric build, but there are better Cleric builds and there are better Assassin builds.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
As has already been noted here, with the EE Death Attack changes a rogue is better than an assassin in almost all ways. For example, a Rog13/Cler26/SD1 would work better than a Cler/Ass/SD and would be able to pick up Epic Dodge while keeping undispellable cleric buffs. If you're sticking with Cler/Ass/SD then a Cler15/Ass23/SD2 gets +20 AB from cleric buffs, level 8 cleric spells, HiPS, and Evasion. You will be constantly managing your buffs due to the low duration but it could work for you, depending on what you want from the build. Cler14/Ass4/SD2 is the best pre-epic spread, which you have already pointed out in one of your earlier posts.

For high assassin builds that also get Epic Dodge I would recommend a Monk9/Ass26/SD5, Rang7/Ass23/SD10, Rang9/Ass21/SD10, or Rog13/Ass26/SD1.

Druids can get up to +24Hide/+4MS from buffs, not including Vine Mine and the +4 Hide/MS bonus from being outside. However for AB buffs, which an assassin heavy build will definitely want, you will need to be a Cleric.
